serinfo.issue: 2008 World, Europe, United States, Canada, and Mexico

descript.abstract:
World Named Latitudes and Longitudes is a polyline theme representing geographically significant reference latitudes and longitudes for the world such as the equator, tropics, Arctic and Antarctic Circles, prime meridian, and International Date Line. Attribute information includes the length, name and degree value of the features.
This dataset is a part of the 2008 ESRI Data and Maps Collection
descript.purpose: World Named Latitudes and Longitudes provides geographically significant latitude and longitude lines of reference for use as an overlay for world level maps.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States: Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local ESRI Regional Office. For support, you may contact ESRI Support Center by telephone (voice) between 6:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing 888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at 909-792-0960; electronic mail (e-mail) support@esri.com; or visit http://support.esri.com/; ESRI holidays excluded.
Outside the United States Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local ESRI International Distributor. This information can be found at http://gis.esri.com/intldist/contact/.
For other questions or comments, you may contact ESRI headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 2000 Version 5.0 (Build 2195) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 8.3.0.800

dataqual.logic: The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using either ESRI SDC Data Development Kit Professional 2 (DDKP2) or tools in ArcGIS. The SDC data set is then loaded into ArcSDE to verify and validate the geometry.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.

horizpa.horizpar: The geospatial part of this data set was mathematically generated using the ARC/INFO GRID extension. In this manner, the locations were computed. The positional accuracy is limited only by the resolution of the data set, which is less than a meter.

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by ESRI: Generated the geospatial part of this data set mathematically using the ARC/INFO GRID extension. Added attributes.

The following steps were performed by ESRI: Extracted data set from ESRI Data & Maps Volume 1. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr). Created projection file (.prj). Created spatial indices. Converted the data set to SDC.

geodetic.horizdn: This data set was mathematically generated. You can define or use it unchanged with data based on any datum.

enttyp.enttypd: The lines represent geographically significant reference latitudes and longitudes for the world such as the equator, tropics, Arctic and Antarctic Circles, prime meridian, and International Date Line.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The length of the latitude/longitude line in decimal degrees.
The name of the latitude/longitude line.

edom.edomvd: A latitude line representing the Antarctic Circle.
A latitude line representing the Arctic Circle.
A latitude line representing the equator.
A line that may or may not be a longitude line representing the International Date Line.
A latitude line representing the North Pole (e.g. Mercator projection).
A longitude line representing the prime meridian.
A latitude line representing the South Pole (e.g. Mercator projection).
A latitude line representing the tropic of Cancer.
A latitude line representing the tropic of Capricorn.
A longitude line that has no name because the 180-degree meridian, in this location, doesn't coincide with the International Date Line.

attr.attrdef: The degree value and direction of the latitude/longitude line.

edom.edomvd: The degree value at the equator.
The degree value at the poles.
The degree value at the International Date Line.
The degree value at the International Date Line and/or the 180-degree meridian.
The degree value at the tropics.
The degree value at the circles.
The line has no value because the International Date Line, in this location, doesn't coincide with the 180-degree meridian.

Outside the United States, please direct all inquiries to your local ESRI International Distributor. This information can be found at http://gis.esri.com/intldist/contact/.

stdorder.ordering: ESRI Data & Maps is available only as part of ESRI software.

distinfo.techpreq: To use this data requires software that supports SDC files.

cntorgp.cntorg: Research Data Services (RDS), Columbia University Libraries

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
